title-group.article-title: How to do a Peer Review

bio.p: LTC Barry Ezell received a MS in Systems Engineering from UVA, 1998 and Ph.D. in Engineering Management from Old Dominion University, 2004. He has authored 22 papers and currently serves as associate editor for MOR and a reviewer for Risk Analysis and Infrastructure Systems journals. Recent work includes a special assignment as technical expert to DHS on methodologies, decision analysis, and integration for the bioterrorism risk assessment (2005-2006) and Chemical, Biological, Radiological and Nuclear Risk Assessment (2007-2008). He is a member of MORS, and an Associate Editor with MOR, with nine years of experience as a reviewer for Critical Infrastructure Systems, Decision Analysis, Risk Analysis, and Reliability Engineering and System Safety.

Dr Jennie Jastrzembski works for the Army Capabilities Integration Center. She worked for TRADOC’s Cadet Command, NATO. Jennie also worked in marketing research and taught college physics and statistics. She experienced in M&S for military experiments, and Multiple-Goals programming.

Jennie received a doctor degree in physics from Temple University. She published papers in Molecular Physics. She is a reviewer for MOR, and presented a study based on Multi-Attributes Utility Theory at the 75th MORSS. She is also a member of INFORMS.
